unit_learning_outcomes.description: Explain biologically inspired algorithms and their roles in AI, and implement some such algorithms in different contexts including adversarial games.
Explain and implement basics of supervised machine learning algorithms
Describe the roles of various search techniques in AI and use appropriate tools to implement them.
Describe the role that uncertainty plays in AI, and demonstrate ability for sound reasoning of different sorts from uncertain knowledge.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: reading to keep up with learning activities.

enrolment_rules.description: 130cp at 1000 level or above including COMP2000 or COMP229 or COMP2010 or COMP225 or COMP2110 or COMP249 or COMP2160

assessments.description: The first assignment will require students to demonstrate their skills in employing their knowledge of machine learning, and programming in Python.

The final examination will assess all the four learning outcomes. With regards to learning outcomes #1, #2 and #3, it allows to accurately assess the appreciation of good programming and problem solving skills. With regards to learning outcome #2, #3 and #4, it will assess students' understanding of fundamental concepts such as different types of search, games and inferences.

This assignment will require students to demonstrate their skills in employing their knowledge of biologically inspired algorithms to develop strategies for adversarial games (#3), and programming in Python (#1).
This diagnostic test will give early feedback on students' understanding of basic AI concepts (in particular search) and Python programming skills (#1).

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Special circumstances
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
data.description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a well-established field that studies how computers and computer software capable of exhibiting intelligent behaviour can be designed. In this unit students will be exposed to fundamental concepts in AI such as agent architecture, knowledge representation, planning and search, as well as their application in some topical domains. Upon completion of this unit students will be able to apply problem-solving strategies that are required to build intelligent systems.
data.title: Artificial Intelligence
